verses.text: 序言尊敬的提阿非羅先生，因為有許多人，已經把在我們中間成就了的事，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.

verses.text: 按照起初親眼看見的傳道人所傳給我們的，編著成書；

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for 'in the beginning'.
Often forms a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 我已經把這些事從頭考查過，認為也應該按著次序寫給你，

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Indicates a past experience.

verses.text: 讓你曉得所學到的道理，都是確實的。

words.note: Often forms a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
In religious contexts, often refers to spiritual truth or teaching.

verses.text: 天使預言施洗約翰出生猶太王希律在位的日子，亞比雅班裡有一個祭司，名叫撒迦利亞，他妻子是亞倫的後代，名叫以利沙伯。

words.note: Lit. 'Baptizing John'.
Refers to the ruler of Judea.

words.definition: to be in power, to reign

words.note: Refers to the priestly division of Abijah.
Refers to a priestly course/division.

verses.text: 他們在 神面前都是義人，遵行主的一切誡命規條，無可指摘，

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.
Often used in religious contexts.
Implies adherence to rules or commands.
Divine title for God or Jesus.
Used as an idiom meaning beyond reproach.

verses.text: 只是沒有孩子，因為以利沙伯不生育，二人又都上了年紀。
有一次，撒迦利亞在 神面前按著班次執行祭司的職務，

words.note: Refers to the Christian God.

verses.text: 照祭司的慣例抽中了籤，進入主的聖殿燒香。

words.note: Divine title for God or Jesus.

verses.text: 燒香的時候，眾人都在外面祈禱。

words.note: Forms a temporal clause with '時候'.

verses.text: 有主的使者站在香壇右邊，向他顯現。
撒迦利亞一見就驚慌起來，十分害怕。
天使說：「撒迦利亞，不要怕，因為你的祈求已蒙垂聽，你妻子以利沙伯要給你生一個兒子，你要給他起名叫約翰。

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts to mean 'to receive (a favor)' or 'to be granted'.
Implies God 'condescending' to listen to human prayer.

verses.text: 你必歡喜快樂，許多人因他出生，也必喜樂。

words.note: A common compound expression for being joyful and happy.

verses.text: 他在主面前要被尊為大，淡酒濃酒都不喝，未出母腹就被聖靈充滿。

words.definition: to be esteemed as, regarded as

words.note: Refers to mild or diluted alcoholic drinks.
Refers to strong or undiluted alcoholic drinks.

verses.text: 他要使許多以色列人轉向主他們的 神。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 他必有以利亞的靈和能力，行在主的前面，叫父親的心轉向兒女，叫悖逆的轉向義人的意念，為主安排那預備好了的人民。」
撒迦利亞對天使說：「我怎麼能知道這事呢？我已經老了，我妻子也上了年紀。」
天使回答：「我是站在 神面前的加百列，奉差遣向你說話，報給你這好消息。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Lit. 'good disappearing/resting' implies cessation of bad news and arrival of good.

verses.text: 看吧！到了時候我的話必要應驗；因為你不信我的話，你必成為啞巴，直到這些事成就的那一天，才能說話。」
眾人等候撒迦利亞；因他在聖殿裡遲遲不出來，覺得奇怪。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis, indicating slowness or delay.

verses.text: 等到他出來，卻不能講話，竟成了啞巴，不斷地向他們打手式，他們就知道他在聖殿裡見了異象。
供職的日子滿了，他就回家去。

words.note: Often used in formal or religious contexts for serving in a position.

verses.text: 過了幾天，他妻子以利沙伯懷了孕，隱藏了五個月，說：

words.note: 懷孕 (huáiyùn) is the compound verb 'to be pregnant'.

verses.text: 「主在眷顧的日子，這樣看待我，要把我在人間的羞恥除掉。」

words.note: Often used for divine care or favor.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Literally 'human realm,' often refers to the world of mortals.

verses.text: 天使預言耶穌降生到了第六個月，天使加百列奉 神差遣，往加利利的拿撒勒城去，

words.definition: be born, descend to be born
words.note: Refers to Christ's incarnation.
Often used in formal or religious contexts.
The preceding space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 到了一個童貞女那裡，她已經和大衛家一個名叫約瑟的人訂了婚，童貞女的名字是馬利亞。
天使進去，對她說：「恭喜！蒙大恩的女子，主與你同在！」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for receiving blessings.
A more formal equivalent to '和'.

verses.text: 她卻因這話驚慌起來，反覆思想這樣祝賀是甚麼意思。

words.note: Indicates the beginning of an action or state.

verses.text: 天使說：「馬利亞，不要怕！因你已從 神那裡蒙了恩。

words.note: Short for 已經 (yǐjīng).
The preceding space indicates reverence for God.
Used here idiomatically to mean 'from God's presence/side'.

verses.text: 你將懷孕生子，要給他起名叫耶穌。
他將要被尊為大，稱為至高者的兒子，主 神要把他祖大衛的王位賜給他，

words.note: More formal/literary than 'give'.

verses.text: 他要作王統治雅各家，直到永遠，他的國沒有窮盡。」
馬利亞對天使說：「我還沒有出嫁（我還沒有出嫁」原文作「我不認識男人」），怎能有這事呢？」
天使回答：「聖靈要臨到你，至高者的能力要覆庇你，因此那將要出生的聖者，必稱為 神的兒子。

words.note: A key theological term for the Holy Spirit.
Often used in religious contexts for divine visitation.
A classical term used to describe divine protection/presence.

verses.text: 你看，你親戚以利沙伯，被稱為不生育的，在老年也懷了男胎，現在已是第六個月了，

words.note: Often used in the context of human reproduction.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates a new situation or current state.

verses.text: 因為在 神沒有一件事是不可能的。」

words.note: The preceding space often indicates reverence for God in Chinese Bibles.
Turns the preceding phrase into an adjectival clause.

verses.text: 馬利亞說：「我是主的婢女，願照你的話成就在我身上！」天使就離開她去了。

words.note: A respectful term for a female servant, often used in religious contexts.
Literally 'body upon', indicating 'on my person/body'.
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.
Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 馬利亞往見以利沙伯後來，馬利亞就起身，急忙向山地去，來到猶大的一座城，

words.note: Refers to a region of hills or mountains.

breakdown.m: measure word for large fixed objects

verses.text: 進了撒迦利亞的家，向以利沙伯問安。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 以利沙伯一聽見馬利亞的問安，腹中的胎兒就跳動，以利沙伯也被聖靈充滿，
就高聲說：「你在女子中是有福的！你腹中的胎兒也是有福的！
我主的母親竟然到我這裡來。這事怎會臨到我呢？

words.note: Often used for events happening to someone.

verses.text: 你看，你問安的聲音一進我的耳朵，我腹中的胎兒就歡喜跳躍。
這相信主傳給她的話必要成就的女子是有福的。」
馬利亞尊主為大馬利亞說：「我心尊主為大，

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.

verses.text: 我靈以 神我的救主為樂，

words.note: A traditional space used before God's name in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Often capitalized in translation when referring to the Abrahamic God.
Can be noun 'joy' or verb 'to be joyful' based on context.

verses.text: 因為他垂顧他婢女的卑微，看哪！今後萬代都要稱我為有福。

words.note: Implies a gracious or humble attention from a superior to an inferior.
Biblical term for female servant, often a humble status.
Used to draw attention, similar to 'lo' or 'behold' in older English.

verses.text: 全能者為我行了大事，他的名為聖；

words.note: Refers to God, the Almighty.

verses.text: 他的憐憫世世代代歸與敬畏他的人。

words.note: Reduplicative form emphasizing continuity through all ages.
Literally 'return to and give to', meaning to be bestowed upon.
A reverential fear, not necessarily terror.

verses.text: 他用膀臂施展大能，驅散心裡妄想的狂傲人。

words.note: Often refers to divine power.
Refers to those haughty against God.

verses.text: 他使有權能的失位，叫卑微的升高，

words.note: Often implies divine or delegated authority.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who have power'.
Forms a noun phrase 'the humble ones'.

verses.text: 讓飢餓的得飽美食，使富足的空手回去。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'the hungry ones'.
Verb-complement structure meaning 'to achieve fullness'.
Forms a noun phrase 'the rich ones'.

verses.text: 他扶助了他的僕人以色列，為要記念他的憐憫，

words.note: Often refers to a servant of God.
Often implies remembering God's covenant or works.
A key theological concept in the Bible.

verses.text: 正如他向我們列祖所說的，恩待亞伯拉罕和他的後裔，直到永遠。」

words.note: Refers to the patriarchs of a people, especially Israel.
Act of showing grace or favor, often by God.
Crucial term for covenant theology and lineage.

verses.text: 馬利亞和以利沙伯同住約有三個月，就回家去了。

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediacy
Functions as a directional complement here
Indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 施洗約翰出生以利沙伯的產期到了，生了一個兒子。

words.note: 施洗 (Shīxǐ) means 'to baptize'
Used in an unusual grammatical construction in this verse
Period for giving birth
Indicates completion or change of state
Indicates completion of action

verses.text: 鄰里親戚，聽見主向她大施憐憫，都和她一同歡樂。

words.note: Resultative verb, 'listen-perceive'
A respectful title for God or Christ
To bestow generously

verses.text: 到了第八天，他們來給孩子行割禮，要照他父親的名字，叫他撒迦利亞。

words.note: Indicates completion of action
Indicates the beneficiary of an action
Verb-object compound: 'perform the rite of cutting'
Indicates intention or impending action

verses.text: 但他母親說：「不可，要叫他約翰。」

words.note: Used with 不 to mean 'must not'
Indicates obligation or strong intention

verses.text: 他們說：「你親族裡沒有叫這名字的。」

words.note: More formal/biblical than 'qīnqi' (亲戚)
Used as a locative suffix here, meaning 'among'

verses.text: 他們就向孩子的父親打手式，看他要叫他甚麼。
他要了一塊寫字版，寫上說：「他的名字是約翰。」眾人都希奇。

words.note: More formal/literary than 'suǒyǒurén' (所有人)

verses.text: 撒迦利亞的口舌立刻開了，就出聲稱頌 神。

words.note: Refers to the ability to speak, often used in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 住在周圍的人都害怕，這一切事傳遍了整個猶太山地，
凡聽見的就把這些事放在心裡，說：「這孩子將會成為怎樣的人呢？因為主的手與他同在。」

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
More formal/literary than '跟' (gēn).
Often used in religious contexts, e.g., 'God is with you'.

verses.text: 撒迦利亞的預言他的父親撒迦利亞被聖靈充滿，預言說：
「主，以色列的 神，是應當稱頌的，因他眷顧自己的子民，施行救贖，

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
The raised space indicates reverence for 'God'.
Often implies divine care or favor in religious texts.
Refers to a people under divine covenant or election.
Formal usage, often with policies or significant actions.

verses.text: 在他僕人大衛家中，為我們興起救恩的角，

words.note: Refers to a servant in a spiritual or divinely appointed role.
Often used for God raising up leaders or saviors.
Biblical metaphor for strength, power, or a savior.

verses.text: 正如主自古以來藉聖先知口中所說的，

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.
More formal/literary than '通過' (tōngguò).
Often used in religious contexts to describe divine utterance.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase.

verses.text: 救我們脫離仇敵，和恨我們的人的手；
向我們列祖施憐憫，記念他的聖約，

words.note: Refers to the patriarchs in a biblical context.
Often seen in compounds like 施行 (to implement).
Also commonly written as 紀念 (jìniàn).
Refers to a divine promise or agreement.

verses.text: 就是他對我們祖先亞伯拉罕所起的誓，

words.note: Used to emphasize or introduce an explanation.
Forms a noun phrase or relative clause with the following verb.
Part of the verb-object compound '起誓' (to swear an oath).
Links the preceding phrase to the following noun '誓'.
Often used in compounds like '發誓' (to make an oath).

verses.text: 把我們從仇敵手中救拔出來，叫我們可以坦然無懼，用聖潔公義，在他面前一生一世敬拜他。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb, often implying disposal or impact.

words.definition: in the hands, from the hands

words.note: Emphasizes drawing out from danger or difficulty.
A modal verb indicating possibility or permission.
A four-character idiom emphasizing composure and bravery.
A four-character idiom meaning throughout one's entire existence.

verses.text: a
孩子啊，你要稱為至高者的先知，因為你要行在主的面前，預備他的路，

words.note: Refers to God; lit. 'the most high one'.
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.
Refers to God or Jesus.

verses.text: 使他的子民，因罪得赦，就知道救恩。
因我們 神的憐憫，使清晨的陽光從高天臨到我們，
光照那坐在黑暗中死蔭裡的人，引導我們的腳，走上平安的路。」
這孩子漸漸長大，心靈健壯，住在曠野，直到他在以色列人中公開露面的日子。
